title: Les Trouvés 2015 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Mourvèdre and Syrah each make up 40% of this blend, with the balance Grenache. The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of garrigue, black pepper and blackberry. The palate is dense and ripe, pulling no punches but delivering a whole lot of hedonistic appeal. The value can't be beat.

title: Leth 2016 Ried Scheiben Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)
description: A fresh, tropical whiff of passion fruit clings to the pear notes on the nose of this wine. The palate, on the other hand, is far more savory, with its textured, yeasty mouthfeel and sage and celery salt fragrance. It's soft but full-flavored.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Gritty in oak, this coastal appellation wine is bright and herbal, offering crisp, vibrant overtones of cranberry, pomegranate, strawberry and rose. A streak of fresh mint and lavender adds floral elements that contribute to its lovely profile of delicate elegance, supported by mellowed oak.

title: Mt. Brave 2014 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)
description: Blended with 14% Cabernet Sauvignon, then aged 18 months in 64% new French oak, this is a lovely example of the variety: velvety, with smoky undertones of oak. Milk chocolate, raspberry and wild truffle combine well on the medium-bodied palate, the finish bright and focused in acidity.

title: Nigl 2016 Ried Pellingen Privat Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: This wine's wonderfully pithy, pear-fruited nose hints at once at freshness and depth. The palate honors this with pristine, ripe pear notes and lovely, fragrant lemony depth. Everthing about this brims with pear and Mandarin fruit, concluding in a refreshing citrusy finish.

title: Oveja Negra 2014 The Lost Barrel Red (Maule Valley)
description: Jammy blackberry, prune, tobacco and oak-grain aromas lead to a flush, chewy and balanced palate, with just enough natural acidity to make things nice. Blackberry and toasty oak flavors include notes of mocha and exotic spices, while this is rich, dense and balanced across a full-bodied finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Paserene 2015 Chardonnay (Elgin)
description: Subtle, nuanced aromas of freshly dried grass, yellow flower and beeswax mingle with notes of honeydew rind, apple skin and Asian pear on the nose of this delicate and superbly balanced wine. The palate boasts a bit more forward-fruit and concentration, with loads of baked apple, honeycomb and toasted nut flavors. A salted butter character and a hint of savory umami unfold on the enduring finish, lending lift and intrigue. Drink now–2023.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Rich in green apple and fig, this wine offers medium-bodied weight and breadth and grainy acidity. From the famous site planted to densely concentrated berries, it's fleshy and textured, with plenty of complexity from spice and oak.

title: Peltier 2015 Estate Grown Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: A big wine that's unabashedly oaky, this one sports a delicious, spicy, toasty, and lightly smoky character from the first whiff through the densely packed flavors and then continues to linger on the finish. The texture is dense, soothingly tannic, and coats the tongue and sides of the mouth with spiciness as well as ripe berry and new leather accents.

title: Pence 2016 PTG Gamay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Pence is one of the few producers growing and making Gamay in California, and they're setting quite a standard. Aromas of red cherry, cola, hibiscus, pomegranate, fennel and cracked pepper lead into a lightly bodied palate full of airy berry fruit, juniper and licorice spice. Quite refreshing and just complex enough.

title: Pierre Amadieu 2014 Romane Machotte  (Gigondas)
description: Whiffs of violet and red raspberry perfume this charming, vibrantly fruity wine. While lavish and full bodied, it's balanced neatly with tart blackberry acidity and finely textured tannins. It's lovely already but likely to maintain well through 2025.

title: Rainbow's End 2015 Estate Wine Cabernet Sauvignon (Stellenbosch)
description: There's a surprising amount of depth and complexity to this wine, given it's price tag. Initial minty, earthy aromas give way to a core of crème de cassis, blackberry and black plum fruit. The medium-weight palate is plush and creamy, with concentrated black-fruit flavors that are framed by a solid tannic structure. Hints of char, tobacco and cigar-box spice unfold on the finish. It should hold well through 2022, but it's an absolute pleasure to drink now.

title: Rémi Niero 2014 Chéry  (Condrieu)
description: Vanilla, honeysuckle and grapefruit are shaded in savory shades of earth, pollen and nuts in this creamy, full-bodied Viognier. It's a hefty, concentrated wine with soft acidity but hints of lemon and orange peel brighten a lingering finish.

title: Robert Perroud 2016 Foudre No 5  (Côte de Brouilly)
description: In 1966 when this wine was first made, the best of the large barrels was No 5, and the name has stuck. It is a rich wine, full of firm tannins with the potential of fine fruit to follow. With its dark structure and acidity it needs to age a few months more. Drink this rich wine from late 2018.

title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)
description: The nose gives very little away. While the palate also still needs to unfold and blossom, it shows all of the elements needed for successful development. Ample freshness and a fine tannic grip showcase the beautifully pure red berry fruit. A beautifully understated and elegant wine, drink 2019–2028.

title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2016 Ried Renner Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: This wine's combination of ivy leaf and golden pear scents makes for a highly seductive nose. On the palate, bright, ripe lemon takes center stage. It lends an appetizing accent of freshness that complements the yeasty texture of the concentrated midpalate.

title: The Farm Winery 2014 Primal Scream Syrah-Grenache (Adelaida District)
description: Very elegant aromas of black plum, black cherry and black currant meet with bay leaf and mint on the deep nose of this blend of 61% Syrah and 39% Grenache. It's soft on the palate, with a cohesive flavor profile that pairs deep berry flavors with pepper and dried herbs. The Syrah is well tamed, proving mellow and soft overall.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2016 Rosé of Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Pale pink in color, this is a pitch-perfect rosé, with aromas of watermelon, pink grapefruit, rose petal and lemon rind. There is great zip to the palate and a chalky texture, carrying fresh but tight red-fruit flavors. It will please New World and Old World fans alike.

title: Undurraga 2015 T.H. Terroir Hunter Carmenère (Peumo)
description: One sniff gives this away as real-deal Carmenère, meaning it's spicy, foxy and fruity, but also herbal and piquant. A deep, firm palate is well cushioned and in balance. This pours on dark flavors of peppery blackberry prior to a toasty finish. If any wine captures the essence of Peumo Carmenère, this is it. Drink through 2022.

title: Viña Maipo 2012 Limited Edition Handpicked Syrah (Maipo Valley)
description: Jumpy berry aromas include notes of juniper and oaky maple. Once this settles, what you have is a fully extracted Syrah with a rich but balanced palate. Spiced plum and wild berry flavors are powerful but show restraint, while this shows savory flavors of dark fruits, olive and spice on the finish.

title: Château d'Or et de Gueules 2015 Qu'es aQuo Carignan (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Violet, bramble and thyme lend depth to deep black-cherry and plum flavors in this lavish Carignan-dominant red. Made from vines averaging 80 years in age, it's richly concentrated and supple. Fresh acidity, firm tannins and hints of earth and spice extend an elegant but bold finish.

title: Château Maucoil 2015 Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Rippling, ripe fruit counteracts deep mineral tones in this bold, brooding wine. Black plum and berry notes are spiced with anise and vanilla, but also shades of dried sage, thyme and earth. It's a concentrated red with a slightly drying, emery-board finish.

title: A.A. Badenhorst Family Wines 2014 White (Coastal Region)
description: This kitchen-sink blend, which includes nine different varieties, is superbly pretty right from the start, with tremendous floral scents that flood the bouquet—honeysuckle, jasmine, apple blossom and fresh fynbos. Supporting fruit flavors of pink apple and white melon rind ground the clean and direct palate. Vibrant and pure, it boasts stony minerality and notes of freshly dried grass that prevail on the finish. It's enticing now, but it should also continue to mature well through 2022.

title: Badia a Coltibuono 2015  Chianti Classico
description: Intense aromas of fragrant purple flower, crushed berry, menthol and cake spice steal the spotlight while the tight, savory palate doles out juicy black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and tobacco. Taut, fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink through 2023.

title: Batasiolo 2013 Brunate  (Barolo)
description: Earthy aromas of forest floor, grilled herb and a balsamic note come together in the glass. The firm, tightly wound palate shows dried cherry, pomegranate, clove and cinnamon while taut, fine-grained tannins provide support. It's vibrant, with bright acidity. Drink after 2023.

title: Benovia 2014 Grenache (Sonoma)
description: Quietly floral, this wine has small percentages of Syrah and Alicante Bouschet. Red licorice and a thread of white pepper play along a thick big-boned entry that softens into a silky wonder as it develops. It highlights the savory aspects of this beloved Rhône variety.

title: Bonny Doon 2013 Le Cigare Volant Reserve Red (Central Coast)
description: This blend of 55% Grenache, 25% Syrah, 16% Mourvèdre and 4% Cinsaut starts of with a reserved nose that slowly offers aromas of roasted cranberries, tangy black plum, dried lilacs and crushed asphalt. The palate shows a dried fruit elegance, with blackberry leather, loamy soils, minty herbs and roasted meats.

title: Adelaida 2016 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: From a historic vineyard, this Chardonnay is quite Burgundian in style, showing much potential for this grape in Paso Robles. Reserved aromas of lemon rind, vanilla shavings and cashew are quite fresh, while the palate drives the middle road, with tight grapefruit rind and mandarin pith flavors on one side and plumeria and guava on the other. Chalky texture throughout.

title: Domaine du Clos du Fief 2016 Tradition  (Juliénas)
description: The Tête family is well known in Beaujolais. Here they have produced a richly textured wine with just the right amount of tannin and acidity to highlight the generous red fruits. Drink this wine from late 2018.

title: Flanagan 2014 Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: This wine is on the edge, complex in white pepper and cool-climate characteristics of dried herb and leather. Brawny and full-bodied, it's also bright in underlying acidity, with plenty of elusive power.
